class_notes:
(Same as FILM 378RW 2)
(Permission Required Prior to Enrollment)


Students must attend the first class to be enrolled in this workshop.


Application required. Complete course atlas information (including texts and grading) and application form will be available on the Creative Writing Program website in LATE MARCH: https://creativewriting.emory.edu/index.html. Please email nora.lewis@emory.edu if you have any questions.


Required writing sample: 2-5 pages in any genre, preferably narrative prose


In this course, students will learn the fundamentals of writing for film. We will explore the basic elements of storytelling - concept, character, plot, structure, dialogue, etc. -- and how each is used in writing for the screen. Students will also learn the format used for film scripts. Throughout the semester, students will write a complete treatment and the first act of an original screenplay, drawing from these theories.  Classes will involve reading and analyzing professional screenplays and also watching films. Students will engage in roundtable discussion of each student's work. Classes will be conducted as workshops in which the main emphasis is on the students' own work, with in-class lecture, film clip review, group writing exercises and open discussion. Students should budget for printing/scripts/videos.
course_description: A writing-intensive course in the construction and formatting of screenplays for upper-level undergraduates, which also broaches various aspects of pre-production planning. Weekly screenings required.
prerequisites: ENGCW 270/270W or ENGCW_OX 270 or ENGCW 271/271W or ENGCW_OX 271 or ENGCW 272/272W or FILM 101 or FILM_OX 101 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
